page.title: 11A Leisure Survey.
page.content: The members of class six decided to do a survey on how the people living in the area spend their leisure time.Each family in the school was given a questionaire and 144 copies were returned. We found the most popular ball games are football,netball,tennis and cricket which are probably played by children at school.Most people spend a lot of time swimming.The families use the Leisure Centres in the nearby towns of Grimsby and Cleethorpes. There, they take part in roller- booting,ice-skating,squash, badminton and swimming.Some people use the public baths,the Church Hall, playing fields and private clubs. Other hobbies are reading, knitting, fishing, walking, gardening and cycling.Families visit historic houses,castles,museums and cities.
